characters: ANOTHER PART OF THE NEVERWHERE DESERT
RIVER BANKS NEAR THE QUEEN'S CASTLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're there Stepek, right on target ... Rabual dead ahead! Suddenly a cacophony of explosions split the air as anti- shells explode ahead of the aircraft, lighting the inside electric blue flashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee!  Thanks for telling me, Holden.  I thought it was Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Ackack guns blast shells skyward.  The gun blasts light u the palm tree background, causing momentary silhouettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ sake, hold her steady!

dialogues.speaker: THE BELLYGUNNER
dialogues.text: He can be seen from outside the plane as the shell flashe light up his turret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit yer bitching Stepek, just drop 'em and let's get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your shirts on guys, tonight I'm gonna hit something. (he settles over the bomb sight) Left two degrees ... steady ... steady ...

dialogues.speaker: THE BELLYGUNNER
dialogues.text: The flak is severe, with electric blue flashes lighting u the fuselage interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kid, how ya doing back there?

dialogues.speaker: THE TAILGUNNER
dialogues.text: Tailgunner momentarily lit with a shell burst, he's scare shitless.  He looks nervously back behind the aircraft at the flak puffs behind the tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gulp, ah ... I'm ah ... okay ... I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Button it up, we're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOMBARDIER
dialogues.text: He is crouched over his bomb-sights, concentrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Stepek, there's the whole island of Rabaul down there, you can't miss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you ...

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Suddenly a shell explodes almost on the windshield and th pilot rears back with the blast.  The right windshield is shattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took a hit ... The co-pilot sags forward, held back only by his shoulder straps.  His eyes stare.  Blood runs from under his helme We know he is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Elkhorn just bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took one back here too. C'mon Stepek, blast 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand on the release button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady ... steady ... bombs away! Let's get the hell outta here!

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND
dialogues.text: We hear the shriek of descending bombs.  The explosions w across the airfield, and in the light of the explosions w see devastation.  The last bomb hits a fuel dump, causing enormous ball of fire. BOMBARDIER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yahoo!  Bullseye!

dialogues.speaker: THE PACIFIC PEARL
dialogues.text: PILOT (exhilarated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shooting Stepek, how are the rest of you guys? FLIGHT ENGINEER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flight Engineer okay. RADIO OPERATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio okay. NAVIGATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Navigator check. BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belly okay. TAILGUNNER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ... tail okay ... There is abrupt silence. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bellson ... Lewis? Still silence, no reply from either name. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, check the waist positions, see if they're okay.

dialogues.speaker: THE TAILGUNNER
dialogues.text: TAILGUNNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ... will do, skipper. TAILGUNNER crosses himself, then exits back into the body the machine.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: PILOT (wearily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home. We hear jumbled comments from all positions.  Everyone is happy. CREW (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers and whoops. The mood of high spirits is stopped abruptly as the tailg reports back. TAILGUNNER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper, Bellson and Lewis are both dead. This is the first time the kid's voice is not scared, jus puzzled. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! BOMBARDIER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well kid, now you got a real bombing mission under your belt.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOMBARDIER
dialogues.text: He removes his oxygen mask and takes a long swig from a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rejoins the rest of the group.  The formation is not quite as tight as before.  As the formation flies along, puffs of cloud pass by, occasionally obscuring a machine.

dialogues.speaker: LOW VIEW OF THE "PACIFIC PEARL"
dialogues.text: Under the "Pacific Pearl's" belly, we see the bellygunner suspended in his small glass pod.  A red glow brightens u as he drags on a cigar.  The rest of the formation are visible stretched to the side and behind as puffs of clou waft past.  We begin to feel as if the weather might be changing.

dialogues.speaker: THE NOSE OF THE "PACIFIC PEARL"
dialogues.text: The BOMBARDIER is relaxing inside as he swigs from the bo and sings raucously.  From the front we look in on the pi with the dead co-pilot sagging in his seat next to him. BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about Elkhorn, skip. What happened? PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno.  The shell exploded and he collapsed.  I think he took it in the head. BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are ya sure he's dead, Skipper? PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. BOMBARDIER (sings drunkenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I put my finger in a woodpecker's hole and the woodpecker said God bless my soul; take it out, take it out, take it out, remove it ... TAILGUNNER (bolder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Stepek, just shut up, okay? BOMBARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up yours kid, wassa matter, you don't like my voice? While all this banter has been going on the cloud has bee thickening.  Suddenly a serious voice cuts in on the smal talk. It's the NAVIGATOR. NAVIGATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong!

dialogues.speaker: THE NAVIGATOR
dialogues.text: He is frantically tapping the compass. PILOT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem, Holden? BOMBARDIER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, the kid's the one with the problem.  He don't like my voice! PILOT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Button it up Stepek.  What's the problem, Holden? NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have a malfunction, my compass says we're heading north!

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: He looks at his compass. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine says east. NAVIGATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can you guys see the rest of the squadron? BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, there's too much cloud. A sudden flash of lightning illuminates the whole inside the plane.

dialogues.speaker: THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: The dead co-pilot's pale face is momentarily electric blu lit by the lightning flash.  We pan past him to the compa the instrument panel.  It is spinning madly. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell ... He reaches forward to tap the compass. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Holden, now my compass has gone crazy.  It's spinning like a son of a bitch! NAVIGATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine too, we must have hit a magnetic field or something !!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE PLANE
dialogues.text: We see a dull glow coming from all crew positions from th on-board lights.  Suddenly a curtain of rain lashes the m PILOT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, now they're all doing it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the dials are going haywire.  Above the instrument pa we see the windshield is spattered with rain. BOMBARDIER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys quit talking business? I'm trying to sing here!  Oh I put my finger in a woodpecker's ... PILOT (irritably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can it Stepek, we got real problems. Just then through the rain, a strange green glow is seen in the distance.  It begins to curve toward the aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE PLANE
dialogues.text: The turret swings as the gunner spots the glow. BELLYGUNNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  Look at that!! From under the starboard wing, we see the object approach PILOT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at what ... look at what!!? BELLYGUNNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's out there, just look at it ... PILOT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ sake, give us a position! BELLYGUNNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about four o'clock, just below ... Holy Shit, it's coming right at us! The glow suddenly zooms at the plane with great speed and the starboard inner engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to push the dead co-pilot back to peer out the broken starboard window ... the number three prop is bent and windmilling wildly.  It has a strange green luminesce about it ... the whole machine shakes. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. The PILOT tries to fly the plane and do the co-pilot's jo feathering the bad engine.  Suddenly it's too late as the wobbles loose and cartwheels over the wing.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE PLANE
dialogues.text: The prop flies back and slices a great gash in the aircra skin, near the TAILGUNNER'S position.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost the goddamned prop ... Did it do any damage?  Kid, check the tail. Silence. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in kid ... kid are you okay? Silence. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis; go check the back. BELLYGUNNER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do, skipper.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HATCH
dialogues.text: TRAVIS' turret opens and TRAVIS pulls himself up into the

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: The gauges are now settled except for the oil pressure to No. 2 engine.  The pressure drops.  The engine heat gauge climbs rapidly.  A red warning light begins to flash. PILOT (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, now what? He glances out of his window just in time to see a strang claw-like feeler coming out of the engine casing.  It det one of the cooling gills, then another, and another.  The away in the slipstream. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gremlins! (rubbing his eyes) Jesus, I must be getting tired.

dialogues.speaker: THE BELLYGUNNER
dialogues.text: He looks in to the kid's reargun compartment.  All that i of him is a tattered skeleton. TRAVIS turns, horror frozen on his face.  Quick as a flas from seemingly nowhere, something flies at him and grabs throat.  The mask on his face falls off, and we get a spl second look of abject horror as he falls out of frame. PILOT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis, what's goin' on back there?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: His eyes are open but he is obviously dead.  Through his headphone, we hear his name.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holden, how far to base? NAVIGATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip, with everything screwed up here, I'd, I'd guess about two hundred miles. All the time the engine pops and bangs wildly. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, find us a place I can put her down!

dialogues.speaker: THE NAVIGATOR
dialogues.text: NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all ocean down there, skip!

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack, can you get us a radio fix?

dialogues.speaker: THE RADIO OPERATOR
dialogues.text: RADIO OPERATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative skip, too much interference.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: He is fighting the controls. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  I've gotta put her down!

dialogues.speaker: THE BOMBARDIER
dialogues.text: BOMBARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Holden ... ya old stuff shirt ... ya wanna snort? PILOT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God sakes Stepek, shut up! STEPEK takes another swig from his bottle.  He is lying o his back partly propped up by the curving nose of the air He is about to make another smart ass reply, when he hear strange scratching and chirping noise above his head.  He looks up in time to see sharp teeth and claws start to ap through the lining above his head.  He blinks in disbelie throws his bottle away as if the image came from the whis BOMBARDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, there's ... there's ... ahh ... keep away ... keep away ... (struggles) ... hey no ... hey somebody ... (screams) NAVIGATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepek, you stupid sonovabitch, will you lay off the booze, you've got the D.T.'s ... STEPEK is wide-eyed and scared silly as the sound now beg under his feet and pincers begin to snip through the floo He suddenly realizes that the whole floor is giving way b him, and he grabs for a handful of cables as the floor co

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE AIRCRAFT
dialogues.text: The lower half of STEPEK is hanging in the slipstream, ki madly.  We see that his legs are covered in wriggling cre

dialogues.speaker: STEPEK
dialogues.text: He is losing his grip with one hand, but still desperatel clinging on to a bunch of cables with the other.  Suddenl an ugly pincer cuts the cables and STEPEK is gone ... out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: Suddenly the No. 2 engine begins to backfire, blasting ba large gobs of orange flame.  The oil, heat and manifold g are off the dial and red lights frantically flash.  Despe the PILOT looks out of the window. Pieces begin flying off the engine.  The cowling disinteg revealing the bare engine beneath.  Small figures are fra busy ripping the engine to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: He is scared. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holden, for God's sake get up here on the double. NAVIGATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem, skip? PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get up here! The NAVIGATOR grimaces as he pushes past the dead co-pilo NAVIGATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, skip? (looking out windows)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS H. CHRIST
dialogues.text: PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold 'em off.  I'm taking her down. He peers out at the incredible sight of the creatures rip off the wing skin and tearing huge plates from the cowlin The camera pans down to his feet as the hatch door handle and then bursts open.  A dozen bat-like creatures swarm i The NAVIGATOR panics and reaches up, grabbing the flare g from its rack.  He screams as the creatures attack and sh right through the creatures, bathing the aircraft with a ruby glow. NAVIGATOR (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay you little bastards ... shit ... (screams)

dialogues.speaker: THE RADIO OPERATOR
dialogues.text: The flare shoots down the fuselage and smashes into him. Wreathed in flames, he falls back into the fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE AIRCRAFT
dialogues.text: Creatures swarm all over the plane.  The ball turret fall off.  A wheel suddenly lowers, then falls off.  A flap fl free and blows away.  Oil streams back into the slipstrea sections of the skin of the plane come away, revealing th skeleton framework of the fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: He is fighting the controls.  Creatures are now in the co plucking out the instruments.  The PILOT reaches to the t only to grab a creature that locks on to his gloved hand. Flying the plane with his good hand, he strikes and pumme at the attacking creatures with the other.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE AIRCRAFT
dialogues.text: It is now almost a flying skeleton.  For the first time, see that it is heading for an island.  A figure detaches from the machine and plummets away.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: He falls, terror-stricken, through space.  Finally his ch opens.  A slimy creature still clings to his gloved hand. off the glove and throws it and the creature away. PILOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling) Jesus H. Christ!

dialogues.speaker: THE ISLAND
dialogues.text: The approaching smoking plane bellies onto the sea, bounc then skims along the wave tops, careening up onto the bea where it twists around crazily before coming to a lopside stop.  The machine faces us head-on and we see a glow com from what's left of No. 3 engine. The camera zooms in rap to a green ball stuck in engine No. 3.

dialogues.speaker: THE PILOT
dialogues.text: He has landed, and is undoing his parachute harness.  He around incredulously.  The island is a junkyard - a verit graveyard of aircrafts.  There are many aircrafts, both o wrecks and futuristic-looking ones lying everywhere.  Ske corpses are still left in some of the wrecks.  The camera to the remains of one machine.  It is an old American Loc Electra.  It glints dull in the half light of dawn.  Pain on its side are two names; "Amelia Earhart" and "Fred Noo The camera continues to move through this panorama of met junk until it stops on a long chrome rod sticking up out a pile of scrap. Tilting up to the sky we see the clouds part as two garga metal arms emerge and descend down toward the junkpile. metal arms reach the chrome rod, grip it tightly, and beg lift it up. WWe follow as the cylinder is pulled higher and higher, f coming to a stop in front of a giant eyeball.  The camera back to reveal that the eyeball belongs to AUSTIN GRIMALD who carefully scrutinizes the orange diode held tightly i needlenose pliers. AUSTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. Satisfied that this is the piece he had lost in the machi he begins to re-solder it in place.  Behind him, a LITTLE GIRL with red hair comes into the room and walks up to hi LITTLE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's broken again, isn't it Daddy? AUSTIN (concentrating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes dear.  But Daddy's fixing it.  (hums) LITTLE GIRL (watching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come it's always breaking? AUSTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, sweetheart.  Mmmmhmm. LITTLE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's fixed, will you make more funny pictures for me? AUSTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, why don't you go play with your toys and let Daddy finish his work, okay?  Mmmm ... LITTLE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. The LITTLE GIRL wanders around to the other side of the m as AUSTIN flips a switch.  Once again the glass sphere sp and the holographic screen lights up.  AUSTIN uses a tool fine-tune the holograph and an image begins to materializ the glass gates of Kraan. As the image becomes clearer, the camera pulls closer and to the holograph screen.

dialogues.speaker: THE GATES OF KRAAN
dialogues.text: The Council's voices still ringing in her head, TAARNA fl in over the demolished gates.  Below her, the once-beauti city lies in ruins. Gliding overtop the deserted streets, she sees a column o smoke rising through the wrecked dome of the building in town's center.  As she watches the smoke rise, she pulls on the reins, and heads her bird up. The camera follows as she rides in through the shattered down to the Council Chambers below. Corpses of the Councilmen are strewn everywhere.  In the center of the room, a large pile of ancient books and manuscripts lie smouldering.  Reaching the floor, TAARNA dismounts and starts to look around.  At the head of the marble table sits the ELDER - dead.  In front of him, a roll of parchment lies on the table.  TAARNA opens it. Carefully painted on the parchment is a circle of mountai their tops glowing green. TAARNA looks at it, and puts it in her sack.  Then she no that the ELDER is clutching something in his hand.  Pryin his stiff fingers apart, she finds a blood-stained medall just like the one her attacker wore on his chain. Looking at the dead ELDER, TAARNA grips the medallion tig in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE COUNCIL BUILDING
dialogues.text: TAARNA flies back out through the shattered dome and surv the city below.  All is quiet and dark, except for a gree coming from a second-floor window.  Curious, she flies ov pulls up beside the window, and climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Entering, TAARNA sees the slimy silk-like cocoon on the b The basket of fruit still sits on the floor.  From within the webbing, the green ball is glowing brightly. TAARNA looks at the parchment in her sack, then at the gl coming from the cocoon.  Cautiously, she approaches the c sword drawn. Suddenly a hand from within the cocoon grabs the ball and shoots forward, ripping through the webbing and holding t ball up to TAARNA's face.  The hand belongs to a hideousl ugly witch, who emerges from the cocoon, cackling through snake-like fangs. WITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold!  The Sphere of Uluhtec! Look upon it, Taarna.  Look upon it with fear.  For in its glow lies the end of heaven - the beginning of hell.  Take it Taarna.  Feel death in your hands.  For death is upon you.  And as you perish ... so dies your race! The witch's eyes go green. WITCH (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it !! She hurls tha ball at TAARNA, who dodges it.  The ball sa past her, out the window.  Then TAARNA, sword raised, lea at the WITCH, slicing through her in rapid strokes. The WITCH cackles and crumbles into dust, but her green e stay suspended in the air, and her cackle echoes through the room. TAARNA backs away, climbing out the window, onto her bird she flies off, she sees the WITCH'S green ball high above rising into the clouds and disappearing.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The WITCH'S green ball zooms through space, as Earth appe in the distance.  Then another object comes into sight. closer we see that is is a modern winged rocketplane of n determinable nationality, soaring high above Earth.  The meteorite passes, briefly bathing the rocketplane in its The rocketplane banks sharply, then stabilizes.  Slowly t hatch-doors in its belly open up, revealing the underside an automobile suspended in the open hatch. Hydraulic metal arms emerge, lowering the automobile out the belly of the cruising rocketplane.  We can see now that the car is a white, '59 Corvette convertible. With a "thunk", the metal arms release the car, and as the rocketplane blasts away, the Corvette begins its free-fall to Earth. As the car falls gracefully through space, the driver pla with the wheel, causing the Corvette to bank smoothly one way, then the other. Once his direction is stable, the driver clicks on the ca radio and adjusts it through various channels, until he s on one. With the music playing, the car falls closer and closer t Earth, entering and emerging from the cloud cover over th atmosphere.  In the heat of entry the vehicle's paint sta burning up. As he heads down over a deserted area, the driver begins approach.  Touching down at breakneck speed, the smoking Corvette bounces violently, every part straining at the repeated impact. The driver's face is expressionless as he jams the car in high gear and floors it, spinning the wheels in an attemp to translate downward momentum into forward motion.  Then he pops his drag chute to help slow down. TThis accomplished, the expressionless driver releases th chute, and speeds off down the road in a cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above the building we see a crowd of reporters and T.V. newsmen waiting on the front steps. The '59 Corvette pulls up at the curb below, and seeing it, the reporters all start to run over. The camera zooms down and into the car.  Inside, the driv reaches over, unplugs a rubber hose, and loosens the two large hex-nuts which connect him to the car.  As he gets the reporters come running up. FEMALE REPORTER (to driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Anrak, six more mutants were sighted in Arizona this morning.  Do you still say this has nothing to do with the green radiation from space. The driver walks on without speaking. T.V. NEWSMAN (walking alongside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor, is it true that the President himself pulled you off the Jupiter Six Project so that you could investigate those mutations? Doctor, answer me that. He ignores the question, and walks past the guard into th Pentagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around a large table sit the Joint Chiefs of Staff, membe the Cabinet, and a pretty secretary wearing a tight skirt An argument is in progress as the expressionless DOCTOR A enters.  The camera follows him as he sits down next to o of the Generals. FAT POLITICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... well what I wanna know is, what's the Army doing about this? Hell!  My constiuents are turning green!  They're growing arms on their backs.  There's something or someone up there in space and the voters have a right to know about it! GENERAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator, we have no proof that these mutations are the result of interference from outer space.  In fact, Doctor Anrak has just come in, so let's hear what he has to say ... Doctor? The room goes silent as the DOCTOR stands up. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, there is no cause for alarm.  As for the theories of interference by alien beings, it is my firm opinion that we on Earth are the only intelligent, technically advanced civilization present in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE PENTAGON
dialogues.text: An enormous round spaceship the size of Pittsburg hovers overhead.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEETING ROOM
dialogues.text: DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and whatever is causing these mutations is not from outer space. it's more likely just an isolated biological pheno ... pheno ... ph ... ph ... ph ... Suddenly the DOCTOR'S head starts to jerk from side to si Everyone looks on, not knowing how to react.  As the DOCT begins to move in short bursts, like a broken robot, he fixes his gaze upon the pretty secretary across the table

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE PENTAGON
dialogues.text: From the bottom of the huge spacecraft, a metal tube emer starts to drill through the roof of the Pentagon.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEETING ROOM
dialogues.text: The DOCTOR starts to shake violently as he stares at the secretary. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty ... pretty ... p ... p ... Suddenly he lunges at her, sliding across the table. As the DOCTOR struggles with the terrified girl, the came pans up to the ceiling, where the metal tube from the spa drills through.  Descending upon them, it sucks them up i DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaarrgghh! SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eeeeeek!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SPACECRAFT
dialogues.text: A metallic robot holding a clipboard, is standing in fron a large glass receiving jar, as DOCTOR ANRAK comes throug the tube and lands in the jar.  As soon as the DOCTOR'S f hit the bottom of the jar, the DOCTOR breaks into a lot o small metallic parts. ROBOT (Mechanical voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nice job.  How am I supposed to fix this guy?  He's fucked. ZEKE and EDSEL, two alien space-pilots, are standing near at the control console.  They look like big furry orange on stilts, with arms coming out of the sider. ZEKE (to Edsel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we turned it up a little too high. EDSEL (to Robot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sorry?  What about me? I've gotta put this asshole back together. Suddenly the pretty secretary comes through the tube and in the jar.  She's a little mussed up, but okay. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasp)  Where am I? ROBOT (staring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, who's the chick? GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well look at my clothes! Who's gonna pay for the dry cleaning?  And where am I? I demand that you return me to my office immediately. ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late - molecular instability zone around spacecraft. You cannot leave. GLORIA (to Zeke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  Is he kidding? ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh ... He looks at the ROBOT, who winks at him. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oh yeah.  Instability zone. You're stuck here. ZEKE and EDSEL try to keep straight faces. GLORIA (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to be at my parents for dinner tonight.  And my gynecologist appointment is on Wednesday. ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.  Would you, ah, like a drink? (leading her away) You'll feel better after a glass of fresh blo-aak. They disappear down a corridor. GLORIA (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any diet soda?

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL CONSOLE
dialogues.text: EDSEL (to Zeke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, typical robot.  The first Earth-chick we see in ten years, and he's gotta make a play for her. EDSEL jams the gearshift into 'D' for Drive, and the ship lifts away from Earth. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do we have any of that Plutonian Nyborg left? EDSEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.  Just one bag.  Uh, it's in the transmitter compartment. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks man. ZEKE opens a hatch and pulls out a double-spouted plastic bag on wheels the size of a steamer-trunk.  It is full of white powder. He pours two fifteen-foot lines of powder onto the floor. Then, he pauses. ZEKE (surveying the lines)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great.  Think this is enough? EDSEL (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh ... nah.  Go for broke. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking, man. As he resumes pouring, ZEKE begins singing to himself in alien tongue.  When the lines are poured, they both stand the start of the trail of white powder, and part their ha to reveal nostrils hidden in their foreheads. ZEKE & EDSEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nose dive! They both start to criss-cross the room, inhaling the whi powder like vaccuum cleaners.  As they happily snort the Nyborg, the camera pans back to the glass receiving jar, moves down through the broken pieces of DOCTOR ANRAK.  Re his lifeless face, the camera moves around to the back of head.  Through the shattered metal we can see a green bal glowing inside ANRAK'S skullpiece.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: As the round spaceship moves through space, a group of asteroids approach and whip past.  Up ahead, a red sun turns white and goes super-nova. EDSEL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow ... good Nyborg!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SPACECRAFT
dialogues.text: GLORIA PEARLMAN and the ROBOT are lying in bed, naked. They have just finished making love.  She is smoking a ci GLORIA (glazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was incredible.  I've never felt anything like it. ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great.  I have been programmed to be fully proficient in sexual activities. Do you want to go steady? GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I don't know.  I already have a boyfriend. ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, what he does not know will not hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL CONSOLE
dialogues.text: ZEKE and EDSEL are sitting at the controls, staring wide- out into space.  They are obviously stoned.  Suddenly a b rings and the communicator screen lights up.  A serious o face appears on it. OFFICER ON SCREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mothership calling starcruiser Alpha ... Mothership calling starcruiser Alpha ... ZEKE looks over at the screen and then shouts into it. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddyawant, man? OFFICER ON SCREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mothership calling Starcruiser Alpha ... EDSEL (to Zeke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta use the microphone. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. (shouts into microphone) Whaddyawant man? OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen, idiot.  Do I have to tell you eight hundred times?  You don't call me "man"!  You call me "Com-Op Officer Blix". Now is that perfectly clear? ZEKE (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.  Whaddyawant, man? OFFICER (disgruntled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are to return immediately to the Mother Ship and pick up a humanoid civilian.  Your orders are to escort him to the Interplanetary Tribunal Courtroom so that he can testify at the trial of Lincoln Sternn.  And make it snappy! The screen goes blank. EDSEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  They finally got Sternn. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time.  Hang on, man. Here we go. ZEKE jams the gearshift into hyper-drive.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: The round spaceship blasts forward at ten times the speed of light.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: ZEKE and EDSEL'S round spacecraft looks like an apple heading toward a freight train as it approaches the enormous mother-ship.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SPACECRAFT
dialogues.text: An ashtray full of roaches sits on the console.  ZEKE is at the controls with a joint in his mouth.  He is swaying back and forth, eyes glazed.  Beside him, EDSEL watches the mothership getting closer. EDSEL (to Zeke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay to land this thing? ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, man.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERSHIP'S LANDING AREA
dialogues.text: Huge red arrows point the way through the ten-mile wide landing area as the round spaceship glides in. EDSEL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're goin' a little high, man. ZEKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, man.  If there's one thing I know, it's how to drive when I'm stoned.  It's like, you know your perspective's fucked, so you just gotta let your hands work the controls as if you're straight. The round ship rams directly into a wall, and crashes dow skidding to a stop in front of the loading bay. EDSEL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow, good landing, man. ZEKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SPACECRAFT
dialogues.text: ZEKE and EDSEL press a button to open the hatch doors. As the door opens we see two metallic Regolian guards waiting on the other side.  Between them stands a small, shabbily-dressed humanoid with a crooked jaw and cauliflower ears.  This is HANOVER FISTE. REGOLIAN GUARD (to Zeke and Edsel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man is to be delivered to the, clik, Interplanetary Tribunal, Courtroom #3, clik, Galaxy versus Lincoln Sternn. Thenk yew.  Clik. The guards wheel away. FISTE (meekly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, hello.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR IN SPACESHIP
dialogues.text: ZEKE and EDSEL escort FISTE down the corridor. EDSEL (to Fiste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, you're gonna testify at Sternn's trial? FISTE nods. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gotta give him at least, like, life. FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln Sternn is a kind and honourable man. (camera pulls close to Fiste's face) He will be freed.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: As the round spaceship journeys through space it passes t a fantastic space-scape of disembodied rock statues, and a magnificent graffiti-covered robot chained to an astero EDSEL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I wish they'd clean this place up, man. ZEKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It's like pig city out here. EDSEL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOT'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: GLORIA is getting dressed as the ROBOT re-charges his ene paks. ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but I don't understand.  We laugh together.  We care for each other.  We have highly proficient sex.  Why can't we get married? GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're different, okay?  Let's leave it at that.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: The hatch opens, and GLORIA and the ROBOT walk through, still talking. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but mixed marriages just don't work.  What if you get tired of me and run off with a vibrator or something? As they move through the room, and out the other side, th pass FISTE, who is sitting quietly near the receiving jar hands folded.  Looking around, FISTE notices a green glow coming from the bottom of the jar.  He gets up, quietly o the jar, and pokes through the scrap robot parts. Finding the small green ball in ANRAK'S head, he pulls it out and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL CONSOLE
dialogues.text: ZEKE and EDSEL are sitting at the controls, driving caref FISTE, carrying the green ball, comes up and sits down be them. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is, man.  I'm gonna hang a louie here. EDSEL (to Fiste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well it won't be long now.  Are you sure you're gonna testify for Sternn. FISTE says nothing.  He just clutches the green ball and into space. ZEKE and EDSEL look at each other and shrug.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE SPACESHIP
dialogues.text: An enormous, brightly-lit, multi-level space station/cour floats into view, completely filling the screen.  ZEKE an EDSEL'S round spaceship is just a speck as it enters the approaching the mammoth structure.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE-STATION LANDING DOCK
dialogues.text: The ship locks into the dock, and the exit hatch opens. GLORIA and the ROBOT come through first, ahead of ZEKE, E and FISTE. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... alright, alright.  I'll marry you - but on one condition ... I want a Jewish wedding. ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jewish wedding!?!!!  But this is space.  95% of the population are robots. GLORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, find me a robot-rabbi! ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! EDSEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give them six months, man. ZEKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even look Jewish! GLORIA and the ROBOT disappear around a corner as ZEKE an escort FISTE through the hatch.  FISTE is carrying the sm green ball. As they lead FISTE away, the camera pulls back, out throu a space-port, and moves along the outside of the slowly rotating space-station.  At the top, the camera zooms dow through a massive glass-domed ceiling and into a huge inter-galactic courtroom. Voices echo below us. PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Captain Lincoln F. Sternn? STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. As we move down, we see square-jawed CAPTAIN STERNN, his shifty-eyed lawyer, and the cold Prosecutor all standing before the Judge. STERNN is smirking confidently as the Prosecutor reads fr a long page of charges. PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln Sternn - you stand here accused of twelve counts of murder in the first degree  ... fourteen counts of armed theft of Federation property ...

dialogues.speaker: THE GALLERY
dialogues.text: The hostile humanoid and alien faces all stare at STERNN hateful, accusing eyes. PROSECUTOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... twenty-two counts of piracy in high space ... eighteen counts of fraud ...

dialogues.speaker: STERNN'S LAWYER
dialogues.text: Mopping his brow, he looks nervously over to STERNN. PROSECUTOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... thirty-seven counts of rape, and one moving violation.  How do you plead?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN STERNN
dialogues.text: Smiling to himself, he nods, then gets serious. STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not guilty! LAWYER (whispers to Sternn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not guilty?!?  Are you nuts?!? STERNN (whispers to lawyer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Charlie.  I got an angle. JUDGE (to Prosecutor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the first witness! STERNN and his lawyer move to their seats. LAWYER (to Sternn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Prosecutor's gotcha cold! Yer as guilty as a cat in a goldfish bowl.

dialogues.speaker: THE COURTROOM DOORS
dialogues.text: ZEKE and EDSEL enter with FISTE, and push their way to th front. PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prosecution calls Hanover Fiste. GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling Hanover Fiste! GUARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling Hanover Fiste! GUARD #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling Hanover Fiste! GUARD #4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanover Fiste! ZEKE and EDSEL sit down, while HANOVER FISTE, small and shabby, walks up to the witness stand, nervously clutchin the small green ball in his hand.  As he passes, STERNN a his lawyer continue to argue. LAWYER (pleading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lissen Sternn ... change the plea to guilty.  Throw yerself on the mercy of the court. STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, Charlie.  I got an angle. HANOVER FISTE is sworn in, as Sternn's lawyer begs. LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the most we can hope for is to get ya buried in secrecy so yer grave don't get violated!  Plead guilty! STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Charlie.  I got an angle. LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What angle? STERNN (pointing to Fiste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him!

dialogues.speaker: WITNESS STAND
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State your name for the record. FISTE (fidgeting nervously with the green ball)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Hanover Fiste.

dialogues.speaker: STERNN
dialogues.text: STERNN (winking to lawyer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised him thirty-five thousand zuleks to testify on my behalf.

dialogues.speaker: WITNESS STAND
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the defendant, (pointing) Captain Sternn? FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know Captain Sternn.  And never did there live a kinder, more generous man.  He is an overflowing cup, filled with the very cream of human goodness ...

dialogues.speaker: STERNN AND HIS LAWYER
dialogues.text: STERNN (to lawyer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: WITNESS STAND
dialogues.text: FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in all the time I've known him, he's never done anything immoral ... (thinking) unless maybe the Pre-Schooler's Prostitute ring ...

dialogues.speaker: STERNN AND HIS LAWYER
dialogues.text: They look at each other, shocked. STERNN & LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?!?

dialogues.speaker: WITNESS STAND
dialogues.text: FISTE (speaking gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and he's ah, never done anything illegal ... (turning sharply) ... unless you count all the times he sold dope disguised as a nun!! (reverting to meekness) He's always been a good, law-abiding citizen ... (shouting at himself) Awww, gimme a break!! (gentle again) ... of the Federation, and, and ... (going schizo) Shut Up!  Shut Up!  Shut Up! (gentle, but starting to sweat) ... a community-concious individual, ah, ah ... (rising in crazed anger)

dialogues.speaker: STERNN
dialogues.text: (pointing as he screams) He's nothin' but a low-down, double-dealin', back-stabbin', larcenous, perverted worm!! STERNN and his lawyer look on, horrified, as FISTE'S body starts to grow. FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hangin's too good for him!! New muscles tear through FISTE'S shabby clothes. FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnin's too good for him!! Growing larger, he starts foaming at the mouth. STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanover ... FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should be torn into little bitsy pieces and buried alive!!! FISTE rams his hands down onto the Witness Stand, shatter it completely. STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanover ... FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill him! He hurls the Prosecutor aside, and moves towards STERNN w thundering footsteps. FISTE

dialogues.speaker: KII
dialogues.text: Still growing, he rips apart the Judge's bench as he pass it.  Finally  he stands towering in rage over the terrifi STERNN. STERNN (to Fiste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-h-hey, Hanover ... n-now take it easy, Hanover, I'm sure we can talk this ov ... Instinctively, STERNN leaps back as FISTE'S giant hands c smashing down in the spot where STERNN stood.  The galler scatters screaming as STERNN runs for the door.  Slaverin FISTE thunders after him.  STERNN runs through the exit, bolting the door behind him.  FISTE follows, tearing the door apart, and bringing the entire courtroom wall down i the process.

dialogues.speaker: STERNN
dialogues.text: Running down a hallway, STERNN passes a group of Regolian cops, who raise their weapons in an attempt to block the rampaging FISTE. REGOLIAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt, clik, in the name of the Federation, clik.  Where is your corridor pass? (to other Regolians) Unco-operative humanoid, clik, blast him. They open fire, but FISTE is unstoppable.  Still growing, he grabs the Regolians's weapons, crunches them up and ea them. REGOLIAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now in violation of Code 103-N-17, clik, paragraph A-64 ... unauthorized consumption of Federation property.  Please come quietly, clik, ... thenk yew. With a single clap of his enormous hands, FISTE crushes t Regolian's metal skulls together into an accordian the th of a dime.

dialogues.speaker: STERNN
dialogues.text: He races through a metallic hallway, and ducks into a boi room, then down a long dark tunnel.  At the end of the tu STERNN comes to a dead-end, and stops to rest. STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this looks good. FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growls) STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, duck under here ... FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you!! STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll turn here! (runs, gasping) Come on feet, don't fail me now! FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sternn!!! STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh ... (runs) Ah, gasp, ah whew, lost him! FISTE

dialogues.speaker: STERNN
dialogues.text: STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Hanover, you've had this coming! Taking a deep breath, STERNN reaches into his pocket, pul out a wad of bills, and counts them out as he hands them FISTE. STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, thirty-three, thirty- four, thirty-five thousand zuleks. Thanks Hanover. FISTE (taking money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'nothin, boss. Counting his money, FISTE starts shrinking back to his normal size. STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Hanover ... FISTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? STERNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. STERNN pulls a lever, which opens up the floor below FIST who screams, falling out into space.  As FISTE slides out STERNN grabs the money from FISTE'S hand and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THE OUTLANDS
dialogues.text: All is quiet across this vast expanse of rusted pipes and barren desert.  The silence is broken by a whistling soun gets louder and louder.  Then, thud! A green ball lands in the dirt in front of us.  Flutterin around it are HANOVER FISTE'S tattered clothes.  Then the burnt ashes of Hanover's body land in a small pile beside clothes.  Panning up we see TAARNA flying on her bird in distance.

dialogues.speaker: TAARNA
dialogues.text: She swoops down and flies through a maze of rusting pipes cables which look like the ramnants of an ancient power s Then she steers her bird through a hidden opening in the floor, and enters a magnificent  secret hideaway cut deep the rock.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE TAARNA'S HIDEAWAY
dialogues.text: Landing her bird on a circular slab of gleaming marble, T dismounts and walks over to a shimmering pool.  Here she and picking up a small gold pitcher, she pours an ancient over herself.  It shines and sparkles as it touches her s Then she steps into the water, where her body seems to sp even brighter. Finishing her sacred bath, she steps out and walks to a s wall.  When she touches it, a rock panel slides away to r a gold chest.  TAARNA opens it. Inside the chest lies a glistening set of armoured garmen so bright that TAARNA must shield her eyes for a moment. as she looks down at the armour, the voice of TAARAK THE DEFENDER comes into her head. TAARAK (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To defend - this is the Pact. but when life loses its value, and it taken for nought, then the Pact is ... to avenge!! Through a series of dissolves we see TAARNA'S hands sensu fitting the various metallic pieces over her firm body. we pull back to see her fully. Standing before us, glistening in the torch-light, she lo magnificent.  Reaching once more into the chest, TAARNA p out a golden sword.  As she holds it, it seems to vibrate almost buzzing in her hands.  Suddenly she swings it, sli cleanly through one of the stone torches on the rock wall the burning torch falls to the ground, TAARNA leaves.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY
dialogues.text: From over our heads, TAARNA comes soaring past, her armou gleaming in the rays of the setting sun.  Below her, she sees a metallic holiday-town filled with barbarian soldie Drunken blue men fight in the streets, strange animals ru around loose, and dead or drunken bodies lie in the gutte Looking down, amidst the melee, she sees three winged cre tied up in front of a bar.  The camera zooms in on one of creature's saddlebags.  It has a silver medallion set int leather, identical to the one which TAARNA pried from the Elder's fingers.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BARROOM
dialogues.text: Barbarian honky-tonk music fills the crowded room, as various barbarian soldiers sit drinking and fondling the bar-girls who are dressed in cheap, flashy metal outfits. Three of the blue barbarians are particularly drunk and rowdy as they push a non-barbarian down, dump a drink on head, laugh and kick him.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: TAARNA walks in through the swinging silver and plexiglas doors, past the three soldiers kicking their victim.  She down at the bar. The three brutish blue soldiers finish stomping the man a walk over to the bar, crowding close around TAARNA. BARBARIAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look.  A new one. (to Taarna) Where you from, baby? TAARNA ignores him. BARBARIAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't talk much, does she ? BARBARIAN #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have to talk for what I want to do with her.

dialogues.speaker: TAARNA'S HAND
dialogues.text: It slowly moves down to her sword, and unclips the safety

dialogues.speaker: THE BARBARIANS
dialogues.text: BARBARIAN #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running his hand across her breastplate) C'mon baby, let's see what's under there. BARBARIAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to undo her breastplate) Yeah, let's have a look. Taarna slowly stands up, pushing their hands away, and ta a step back. BARBARIAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heey, she's tough. BARBARIAN #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she wants to fight? They all laugh. BARBARIAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... or maybe she wants to take us all on? Still laughing, they move towards her. In a blinding flash, TAARNA draws her golden sword, and w it like a Samurai master, slices off all three of their h In an instant, the sword is back in its sheath. The barbarian's heads stop laughing as they fall to the g The music stops, and everyone in the bar stares at TAARNA Stepping over the bodies, TAARNA walks up to the bartende pulls out the parchment picture of the glowing mountains, shows it to him.  The bartender looks at it carefully, th points out the window. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the oasis. TAARNA nods and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: His eyes start to turn green.  The camera gets closer and closer to his glowing eyes, until the green glow turns in the image of a ball, lying in the ground, in AUSTIN'S hol

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: AUSTIN is crouched over the machine turning several knobs trying to make the ball move.  Nothing happens. AUSTIN (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm ... must be jammed. Frustrated, AUSTIN picks up a flashlight, opens up a comp underneath the control knobs, and takes a look inside.  W AUSTIN fiddles inside the machine, we see two hands appea the holograph screen and pick up the green ball.  AUSTIN over to the holograph and notices. AUSTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: THE HANDS
dialogues.text: As the hands cradle the green ball, the camera pulls back to reveal a skinny, unco-ordinated boy wearing thick eyeg carrying the sphere across his backyard.  This is DAN. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all started when I found the green meteorite.  I read in Farraday's "Life of the Planets" that smaller ones like this are supposed to burn up when they enter the atmosphere, but for some reason this one didn't ... DAN carries the ball into a typical small-town house.

dialogues.speaker: T.V. ANTENNA ON ROOF
dialogues.text: As the narration continues, we follow two red wires down from the T.V. antenna, along the roof, and into DAN'S att window.  The wires run through a bucket of water and are up to some electronic parts on DAN'S desk. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... so I brought it up to my room, stuck it in my rock collection and forgot about it.  I was experimenting with natural electricity ... The camera pans around the room to show various displays DAN'S scientific tinkering - blue-ribbon science projects transparent models of a man and a woman showing all inter organs, and many books. In the corner, the green ball sits in DAN'S rock collecti At his desk, DAN impatiently shuffles through the dusty p of an old scientific journal. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and with the storm warnings up, I figured maybe tonight I'd hit the jackpot.  All I needed was a little juice. He looks out the window at the gathering storm.

dialogues.speaker: THE STORM
dialogues.text: Crackling from the sky, a bolt of lightning strikes the television antenna and surges along the wires into the at

dialogues.speaker: DAN'S ATTIC ROOM
dialogues.text: The lightning flashes into DAN'S apparatus, lighting it u brightly. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works! Suddenly, an electric arc jumps from the bucket of water and crosses the room to join with thw ball on his shelf. Caught in the middle, DAN begins to glow green. DAN (looking at his green arms)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus! The electrical field opens up a shimmering gateway into a universe and DAN de-materializes.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRANSFORMATION
dialogues.text: We float in darkness for a moment as black shapeless imag zoom past. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt like I was nothing - just atoms floating in the darkness ... Then, tiny beams of light join to form a glow in the corn of the screen. The glow gets brighter and starts moving s around the screen.  Now, we can make out some of the imag whipping past - a half-formed hand, pages of a book, a cr pyramid, a green ball. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a body started to re-form around me.  Only it wasn't my body - this one had muscles. Sturdy muscular parts begin to materialize around the mov light.  They join up with each other to form a powerfully human figure. Finally a man's face takes shape, and as it forms, eveyth gets brighter and clearer. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a great body, but I wasn't too crazy about the face. The powerful figure, DEN, turns slowly as he floats and b to look at his hands and arms.  Moving his mouth, he spea a new voice - deep and powerful. DEN (feeling head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm ... no hair. Suddenly, the background explodes into fields of radiant as the body accelerates away from us and passes through a shimmering gateway.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEVERWHERE PYRAMID
dialogues.text: DEN, strong, masculine and hairless, materializes cradled the hand of a huge stone idol.  He is naked and unconscio Above him, the glowing green ball is held in the idol's o hand. The camera pulls back to show that the idol is standing o deck, stop a huge, truncated pyramid.  The deck forms a w around a swirling pool of green water. Kneeling all around the seething pool, are lizard-men, we priest's robes.  Two of them stand beside a glass coffin. the coffin, lies a naked girl, bound and gagged. PRIESTS (chanting softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uluhtec, Ulutec ... Directly in fron of the idol, a regal-looking QUEEN, wear a revealing velvet cloak, is praying to the raging water. QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the powers of the glowing Loc-Nar placed in your idol's hand, I demand you come forth, Uluhtec! The waters of the sacrifical pool rage more violently and a low rumble is heard far below.

dialogues.speaker: THE IDOL'S HANDS
dialogues.text: The green ball, (Loc-Nar), glows brightly as DEN opens hi looks down and notices his enormous genitals. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm ... big! Seeing an animal-skin hanging from the idol, he rips off piece and wraps it around himself. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no way I was gonna walk around this place with my dork hangin' out! Suitably covered, he surveys the ritual taking place belo DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  This looked like something right out of the Ten Commandments.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE OF RAGING POOL
dialogues.text: The QUEEN is kneeling before the seething water. QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant me your strength in return for a living mortal sacrifice!  It has been ordained.  Come forth Uluhtec! I demand it! Two lizard priests remove the terrified girl from the gla case and hold her out over the swirling water.  The QUEEN nods and the two priests drop her in.

dialogues.speaker: THE IDOL'S WATER
dialogues.text: Seeing the girl struggle in the water, DEN'S eyes grow wi DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd they do that for? He stands and dives into the raging pool, swimming powerf towards the drowning girl.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER WATER
dialogues.text: Reaching her, DEN grabs the girl's  bound ankles, hooks t over his head and drags her through a decayed hole in the underwater wall.  Inside a stone tunnel, they are swept a by the current. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, I'd be dead by now.  I kept thinking I was going to run out of air, but my new body worked great.  I just hoped her body was working as good as mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEN and the girl are washed out into a pond at the center a beautiful field of lilies.  He pulls her out of the wat unconscious.  As he unties her, she begins to stir. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She takes DEN'S hand and lies back in the flower, her beautiful breasts exposed in the sunlight. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had the most beautiful eyes. I wanted to make some conversation but I found my new self asking the same old stupid questions. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you from around here? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you may not believe this, but I'm from another world - from a place called Earth. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth?  I too am from Earth. How did you get here? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Katherine Wells, and I'm from the British colony of Gibraltar.  Time makes no diff- erence here, but there it was the summer of 1892.  It was evening - I'd gone for a walk on the cliffs when suddenly a sphere fell from the sky.  Following its glow, I came to a shining gate made out of light.  Unable to resist, I stepped through it and awoke in this world.  There I was thin and weakly, fit only to stay indoors. (she stands up) But here, somehow I am stronger, more alive, (she stretches seductively) ... more fully a woman. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not kidding. DEN (standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, too seem better equipped on this world. (he holds out his arm) My arms are more powerful. (strecthes his fingers) Even my fingers seem to hold great strength. KATHERINE walks up close to DEN, takes his hand and touch the fingers to her breast. KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life.  I have no reward to give you, but if any part of me pleases your senses - I would give it willingly. She circles her nipple with his baby finger. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  This was great!  There was no way I'd get a chick like this back on Earth.  I mean, look at her!! Taking KATHERINE in his arms, DEN lays her down on a bed flowers and begins to tenderly make love to her. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was only one problem ... A spiked boot appears in the frame.  The camera pans up t show a large, ugly hairy beast-man standing over DEN and KATHERINE. The camera then pulls back to reveal the entwined couple, completely surrounded by a horde of grim, bestial warrior DAN (V.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who these jerks were, but they sure picked a bad time to show up ... The ugly beast-men grab DEN and KATHERINE as we;

dialogues.speaker: ARD'S THRONE ROOM
dialogues.text: The beast-Captain keeps his machine gun trained on DEN as the soldiers lead him into the cavernous room. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They split us up and took me to this weird castle-type place. I wanted to find out where they'd taken Katherine, but none of these guys seemed to speak English. In the middle of the room there is a round stone pedestal with a throne carved into it.  On the throne sits ARD, a child-like ruler with a sadistic glint in his eye. ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tell me you are Den of Earth, the one who dared to steal the female sacrifice from the Queen. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy was a shrimp so I figured I'd play it tough. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the girl? ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Ard - supreme leader of the revolution and the next ruler of the world. DEN (tougher)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl!! ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, aren't we fierce? If you are truly as tough as you seem, then you will serve me well.  But first, a test. Guards!  Castrate him! DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Two bestial guards approach from behind, brandishing curv short-swords.  DEN turns instinctively, dodges the first and delivers a bone-shattering elbow to the beast's head, crushing his skull. Spinning with his own momentum, DEN throws a rock-hard fi into the second guard's chest, snapping his rib-cage and sending him flying across the room. Without pausing, the bald muscleman grabs the nearby beas Captain and lifts him into the air by his machine-gun.  T Captain hangs on as DEN twists the gun, butts it into the creature's groin and then drives the weapon through the Captain's jaw. The creature crumples, leaving DEN with the gun. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy!  I was pretty good at this stuff. ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  You are worthy to serve me. DEN (aiming machine-gun at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the girl or die. ARD (taking it lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if I have a choice, I'll take death. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it. DEN fires, spraying a row of bullets across ARD'S body. bullets blast big yellow holes in ARD'S chest, but there no blood.  ARD looks up and laughs. ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha!  You'll have to do better than that. As DEN looks on, ARD'S wounds miraculously close up and h themselves over. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could see why they made this guy their leader. ARD (standing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but if you're really interested in the girl; I've had her encased in glass. ARD pulls the velvet covering off of a glass box to revea KATHERINE, unconscious, sealed inside. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead. ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually no.  She's sleeping, but only I can awaken her. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want of me? ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to steal the sacred Loc-Nar. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this Loc-Nar? ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen's glowing sphere, you fool.  The sacrifice to Uluhtec can only be performed by the possessor of the sacret Loc-Nar. (calling out) Norl! NORL, a huge gorilla-man, in a purple cloak, steps forwar ARD (to Den)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Norl, my bravest warrior. You will go with him to the Queen's castle and steal the Loc-Nar.  Then I will give you the girl. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I refuse? ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you refuse, you die, she dies, everybody dies. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounded reasonable to me. DEN looks down at KATHERINE'S motionless body.

dialogues.speaker: RIVER BANKS NEAR THE QUEEN'S CASTLE
dialogues.text: In the moonlight, DEN and NORL lead a squad of beast-warr armed with automatic weapons, along the river towards the castle. NORL (to Den)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssh.  Guard post ahead.  We must go underground. NORL lifts a rock to reveal an underground passageway. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy Norl seemed to know what he was doing.  And, for a gorilla, his English wasn't half bad. DEN and the warriors enter the underground passage.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND TUNNEL
dialogues.text: The group, carrying torches, moves along the dark tunnel. pass a bubble-window with shark-faced eels swimming on th side. NORL (to Den)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're underneath the castle moat. DEN nods.  An ugly growl echoes through the tunnel up ahe the warriors freeze and murmur to each other in their own languages. DEN (to Norl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they saying? NORL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They talk of the savage beast who prowls these catacombs with a fierce hunger and sharp teeth ... (gestures) six inches long. A dog-faced warrior shakes his head and says something to NORL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry ... (indicating) ... sixteen inches long. Suddenly, a savage beast appears and chomps his long, raz teeth into one of the warriors at the end of the line.  D and the remaining warriors run on through the tunnel as, them, the monster pulls his victim apart.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY IN CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: DEN, NORL, and the remaining warriors arrive at a door in rock wall. NORL (to Den)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we separate.  You and Korg take this door into the Queen's quarters.    The rest of us will move through the walls and enter her chamber from the other side. Whoever gets the Loc-Nar first will return it to Ard.  Good luck, Den. DEN nods, puts out his torch and carefully opens the door NORL moves off.

dialogues.speaker: DARK ROOM
dialogues.text: DEN and KORG silently enter.  Across the dark room, the glow of the green ball casts a pale light. KORG (whispers and points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loc-Nar. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  It was just like the ball I dug up in my back yard. They tip-toe towards it. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I saw the Loc-Nar's glow I had this real funny feeling.  All by themselves, my hands reached forward to touch it.  But the Loc-Nar moved out of the way. Instead, my hands felt something else - warm flesh.  Then the lights came on. In the brightly lit room, DEN is standing before the beau semi-clad QUEEN, and holding her firm, naked breasts in h Looking around, he sees that he and KONG are surrounded b brigade of the Queen's ugly guards, swords raised. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about embarassing! QUEEN (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them. The Queen's guards attack with battle-axes, clubs and swo As DEN knees one in the groin and swings his gun into ano face, four of the guards surround KORG and club his brain But DEN, still going strong, throws two guards into the w and heaves a third out the window.  As the QUEEN watches glee, more guards rush into the room and DEN is finally o powered and held down.  The Captain of the guards places knife against Den's throat. CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I slit his throat, your Majesty? The QUEEN, eyeing Den's magnificent body, sighs. QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, slit his throat. CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your Majesty. As the Captain presses his knife against Den's flesh, the QUEEN suddenly raises her hand. QUEEN (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  I have, ah, something better in mind. She takes Den's hand and leads him into an adjoining room the guards grumble to one another. GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, not again. GUARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This always happens. CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, she's the Queen.  She can do whatever she wants. GUARD #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: THE QUEEN'S BOUDOIR
dialogues.text: The QUEEN stands before DEN, hands on her hips and a funn in her eye. QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you please me, I may let you live. She smiles, and approaches DEN. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What must I do? QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfy my appetites. The QUEEN lets her cloak drop to the floor as she gets cl She is naked underneath. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  Eighteen years of nuthin' and now, twice in one day.  What a place! QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. She steps forward and takes his hand, leading him towards bed.

dialogues.speaker: THE QUEEN'S BED
dialogues.text: DEN and the QUEEN are lying undressed on the enormous bed The QUEEN has a very contented look on her face.  DEN loo exhausted.  As the Neverwhere moon rises outside the cham window, the QUEEN slowly runs her hand over DEN'S bulging muscles. QUEEN (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rising moon climaxes our love, Den.  Is is a sign, a new beginning. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, a sign. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea what she was talking about. QUEEN (stroking him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neverwhere is a troubled land, but together we could calm it. We could rule side by side. Your strength has brought great peace to my restless body.  It could bring great peace to all the troubled people of this land. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I was good, but I didn't know I was that good. Suddenly the Captain and his guards burst through the doo CAPTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty!  The Loc-Nar is missing - stolen! The QUEEN jumps to her feet in a rage and points to DEN. QUEEN (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiend!  You make love to me while your accomplices steal the magic sphere!  Guards!  Take him! The guards grab DEN as the  QUEEN snatches one of their b spiked clubs. QUEEN (to guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold him still!  I will kill him myself! DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, was she pissed off! Heaving the guards aside, DEN breaks free and jumps out t chamber window.

dialogues.speaker: THE CASTLE WALL
dialogues.text: DEN falls down, down into the swirling waters of the cast moat.

dialogues.speaker: THE QUEEN
dialogues.text: She is livid. QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare the flying lizards. I want his head!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CASTLE
dialogues.text: Pulling himself out of the moat, DEN knocks a guard off h leopard/horse and rides off.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEVERWHERE PYRAMID
dialogues.text: ARD is kneeling at the edge of the sacrificial pool.  Bes him sits a long glass case wrapped in chains.  Through th chains we see KATHERINE trapped inside - fully conscious terrified.  Ard's bestial warriors stand all around carry torches and spears. Above them, the Loc-Nar sits glowing in the stone idol's ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the power of the magic Loc-Nar placed in your idol's hands, I command you - come forth Uluhtec! The green water in the pool immediately begins to churn violently and leap into the air.  A bolt of lightning crackles in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEVERWHERE DESERT
dialogues.text: DEN is racing across the barren desert on his leopard/hor Visible in the distance is the outline of the huge, trunc pyramid where he first saved KATHERINE. As he rides, he sees the green glow of the Loc-Nar, spark in the glass surfaces of the coffin in front of it. DEN (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine! He spurs his leopard/horse on into the night.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE NEVERWHERE DESERT
dialogues.text: The QUEEN, riding a flying lizard, leads her army in purs of DEN. SOLDIER (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is, your Majesty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, silhouetted in the moonlight, she sees DEN, rid the steps of the pyramid.  The camera pans to the green g atop the torch-lit pyramid. QUEEN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Loc-Nar!

dialogues.speaker: THE QUEEN
dialogues.text: QUEEN (shouting to her men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster!  To the pyramid! She whips her lizard harder.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEVERWHERE PYRAMID
dialogues.text: ARD is incanting to the raging water while two hooded mon stand beside him, holding the struggling KATHERINE out ov the pool. ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is your sacrifice, Uluhtec. Now, give me your power! (to monks) Throw her in. Chanting the name "Uluhtec", the two monks start to throw the girl in when suddenly a third monk leaps forward and grabs her, kicking the other two monks into the water. The intruder's hood falls away and his bald head gleams i moonlight. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine! KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Den! ARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You'll ruin everything! ARD jumps up and runs toward the Loc-Nar, perched in the idol's hand.  Grabbing it, ARD holds the glowing ball abo ARD (to his guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them!  Kill them both! Suddenly, a hand leaps out of the darkness, gripping the Loc-Nar just above Ard's hand - it is the QUEEN. QUEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Loc-Nar is mine! ARD (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid bitch!  Get away from me! As ARD and the QUEEN fight over the Loc-Nar, the Queen's pour in and battle with Ard's soldiers.  Thunder roars ov

dialogues.speaker: DEN
dialogues.text: Holding KATHERINE in one arm, DEN smashes a nearby soldie grabs the beast's spear.  With the battle raging all arou him, DEN looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY
