dialogues.text: Lightning crackles, illuminating the night with electrici

dialogues.speaker: DEN
dialogues.text: DEN reaches down, picks up the long chain that was wrappe the glass case and attaches one end to his spear.  He kic other end into the raging water, then heaves the spear with all his might into the head of the stone idol. In the same instant, a bolt of lightning fires down from striking the idol full force.  The lightning bolt travels the spear and down the chain, into the water.  Suddenly, electrical energy arcs across to join with the Loc-Nar. Holding onto the Loc-Nar, ARD and the QUEEN begin to glow then de-materialize into a shimmering dimensional warp. troops stop fighting and look on in amazement, until all that remains is the glowing Loc-Nar, hanging in mid-air. KATHERINE (to Den)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did they go? DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are gone.  That is all that matters. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They probably went back to Earth. Boy, will Mom be surprised. Suddenly, the Loc-Nar falls to the ground at Den's feet. KATHERINE (looking down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Loc-Nar ... you could have the power of Uluhtec.  You could be ruler over all these people. DEN (looking over the throng)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. In a single powerful leap, DEN, carrying KATHERINE, bound onto the Queen's flying lizard and they fly off.  The ama watch for a moment, then shrug and resume fighting.

dialogues.speaker: DEN'S FLYING LIZARD
dialogues.text: KATHERINE clings to DEN as they fly. KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but Den, with the Loc-Nar you could have returned to Earth. DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it better here. The lizard banks sharply away from us and carries them in distance. DAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Earth, I'm nobody.  But here, I am DEN.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEVERWHERE PYRAMID
dialogues.text: The camera pans down the stone statue to the glowing sphe which lies abandoned on the ground.  The soldiers are gon we watch, time begins to accelerate and the Neverwhere Py ages and crumbles all around the green ball.  The earth h and shifts, and dense vegetarian grows up through the cra the ground. A prehistoric man walks up and sees the glowing ball unde Fascinated, he picks it up and looks at it, as the foot o Tyrannosaurus Rex comes down, crushing him. Time advances again as the dinosaur becomes a skeleton, a a Biblical tent-community grows up around the ball.  In t fire-light, the Nomadic tribesmen are watering their anim when one of the camels paws at the ground, uncovering the ball.  Scared, the camel struggles and trys to break its Out of nowhere a Roman Legion attacks, slaughtering the t Time accelerates again, and the conquering Romans build a placing the green ball in the head of a golden idol.  The Romans grow fat and debauched, while slave-girls feed the As the ball glows, the temple crashes down around the deb Romans, covering them and the green ball in rubble. Over the ruins of the temple, a succession of primitive m clay huts evolve into the thatched-roof cottages of a Med village. A Medieval stone-cutter finds the ball, and mortars it in his stones as he builds a water well in the centre of the Satisfied with his work, he lowers the bucket to draw him a drink.  Behind him, an  ox-cart comes roaring around a The axle breaks and a heavy wooden wheel careens along, s the stone-cutter in the back and knocking him into the we Time advances once more as the Medieval village grows and transforms into a Victorian-style town.  It is evening, a the stone well now sits under a gazebo at the centre of a lit village green. A fancy carriage carrying a Victorian gentleman passes by circles the green. Moving in through a window across the street, we see a se looking woman dressing herself in black garters and lace. is intercut with the carriage circling the green, until t woman, who looks like a high-class harlot, finishes dress leaves her room.  Crossing the street, she walks up to th and leans provocatively up against the well. The gentleman gets out of his carriage, approaches the wo and propositions her.  She smiles, touches, and teases hi pan down their legs to the green ball glowing in the well Suddenly red blood begins to drip over the ball, and the body falls to the ground.  The camera pans up to the well where the gentleman is washing the blood from his hands. As time begins to move forward again, the man ages and ho away, as the well crumbles and cheap turn-of-the-century housing grows up, covering the green ball.  The town beco dirtier and blacker, and smokestacks blow soot into the m sky.  Almost on cue, the doors of the houses open, and gr coal-miners emerge, shuffling through the filthy streets their way to work. The camera pans down to a drain in the gutter.  A rat app Panning back up, the street is now empty.  A bell is hear ringing, and a horse-drawn Red Cross cart pulls around a and into view.  Masked workers follow the cart.  One ring the bell, while the others pull corpses from the doorways load them into the cart.  The gutters and windowsills are full of rats.  Time advances again and the buildings beco deserted derelicts.  Their decaying timbers groan under t weight. A support snaps, and one of the buildings starts to colla Falling amidst the crumbling plaster and rotting wood is glowing green ball.  As the ball hits the ground, it is c over by rubble. The rubble becomes bleached by the hot sun and the landsc grows drier.  Sand blows all around, covering over everyt As the sandstorm clears, the entire terrain is nothing bu desert.  In the distance we can see a group of people wal

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE
dialogues.text: The people appears to be a band of aboriginal workmen, ca futuristic laser-shovels over their shoulders.  They are a goateed archaeologist with an elaborate metal detector. he walks, his detector starts bleeping.  He points to a s on the ground, and the natives start digging with their l shovels. One of the workers finds something. WORKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuma!  Kuma!  Kuma! The archaeologist waves the workers away and directs a tr driven shovel-sifter up to the spot.  The shovel-sifter d in and pulls up a large chunk of desert.  When the sand h sifted out, we see the tarnished Loc-Nar in the machine's It is not glowing.  The machine swivels, and a native for plucks the Loc-Nar from the shovel-sifter's teeth. As the foreman touches it, the Loc-Nar starts glowing bri The foreman's hands turn green.  He looks at his green ha then he looks over to the archaeologist.  Suddenly the fo entire body glows green, and crumbles into dust. The archaeologist and the natives stare in horror at the glowing Loc-Nar, lying in the pile of green dust.

dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK
dialogues.text: The camera comes down from high above the city.  The gene shape and outline of New York looks familiar, but as we g closer we sense that something is different.  Fires are burning in various locations below us, and intermittent gunshots become audible as the narration begins. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, New York, big deal.  Scum-centre of the world. Moving down through the skyscrapers, the city gets dirtie slummier.  We pass a dead man hanging from a tenement clo Below us, scruffy children dodge traffic as they play gyr in the garbage-filled street. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now they're talking about letting in low-lifes from other planets, too. Under the narration, the camera turns a corner and zooms through the roof of a parked taxicab.  It stops full fram the newspaper held in the cabdriver's hands.  A slow pan the front page reveals that the paper is the New York Tim July 6, 2031 One headline reads: "400,000 Traffic Deaths Over Holiday Another reads: "Venus Declared 73rd State". The camera stops on a headline reading: "Professor Discov Ancient Relic --- to be shown in N.Y. Museum". There is an accompanying photo of the goateed archaeologi his beautiful daughter standing beside a glass and metal containing the Loc-Nar. A knocking is heard on the cab's window, and the driver t down the newspaper. YOUNG MAN (from outside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You free? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Get in. (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Harry Canyon.  I drive a cab. He flips a switch which unlocks the rear door.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE CAB
dialogues.text: The young man climbs into the back seat and closes the do Harry's yellow Checker cab pulls out into traffic.  The vehicle looks pretty normal except for some vaguely futur chrome panels cut into the sides, and thicker, deeper bum

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CAB
dialogues.text: Harry slides open the plexiglass shields separating him f his passenger. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to, pal? YOUNG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U.N. Building. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U.N. Building.  What a joke. Used to be a nice place until they turned it into low rent housing. Now it's a dump.  I wouldn't live there if you paid me. He switches on the car radio.  The music plays as Harry's cab passes various time-altered New York landmarks; a gra -covered Empire State Building - windows all boarded up, decrepit Lincoln Centre, the marquis reading "Continuous Sex Show, Also Inter-Planetary Mud-Wrestling", new ultra- buildings crammed between half-destroyed Wall Street offi buildings, garbage everywhere. Inside the cab, the YOUNG MAN pulls a gun out of his jack sticks his arm through the opening in the plexi-glass shi and holds the gun to Harry's head. YOUNG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay sucker, hand over your cash, now! HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This city is really going to the dogs. Harry's foot stretches forward and pushes a footswitch. A buzzing is heard, and the young man's body suddenly dematerializes.  The gun which he held at Harry's head falls to the seat beside HARRY, who picks it up and tosse into the glove compartment, beside all sorts of other fut guns and weapons. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid asshole.  Nobody touches me unless I want 'em to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera is close-up on the illustrated banner over the entrance.  The banner reads; "Treasures of the Loc-Nar - July 8th". We pan down to the museum doors, as a man's body comes cr through the plate glass and sprawls forward, cut and blee It is the goateed professor from the desert.  His daughte runs out behind him, ripping her clothes on the broken gl

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: Run! The girl takes off down the museum stairs as men with las guns come out and start firing.  A fat, evil-looking man bends down and grabs the professor's head, jerking it up.

dialogues.speaker: RUDNICK
dialogues.text: (to henchmen) He's dead.  Get the girl! The girl, clothes torn, runs out into the street, just as Harry's cab comes cruising by.  She runs alongside, pound on the window.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (to Harry) Help me, please!! A laser shot narrowly misses her and blasts Harry's side- HARRY flips the switch, unlocking the passenger door, and her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally my rule is "Don't get involved", but something about this dame got to me. She dives in the back and HARRY floors it.  The cab screa away as Laser-shots land all around.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (in shock, breathless) The Loc-Nar ... they wanted it ... but my father wouldn't tell them ... now I'm the only one ...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (interupting) Relax sister.  There's a cop station up here.  You can ... HARRY looks at her in the rear-view mirror.  The girl has

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I needed ... guess I'm a sucker for a pretty face.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: The police station is an all-metal building with no windo A plaque on thr front reads "N.Y. POLICE - 52nd DIVISION" Harry's cab pulls up.  He gets out, carries the unconscio GIRL up to the front door, and pushes a buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (over intercom) Police.  Whaddya want?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I wanna report a murder.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (over intercom) So what else is new?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You gonna let me in or what? A buzzer sounds and the door slides open.  HARRY carries GIRL in and heads across the room toward the main desk. he walks he passes cops using a strange metal detector/va cleaner to suck dangerous weapons from a pair of suspects of weapons can be seen in the machine's transparent belly

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Okay, this guy's clean - next. HARRY comes up to the front desk and starts to lay the gi down in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (to Harry) Before you go any further pal, I gotta tell you, it's cash up front.  A thousand bucks a day for a full investigation. Another thousand if the assailant is caught. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah thanks ... He picks up the girl and turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ... for nuthin'!

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (shouting after Harry) You think you can do better? Join one of the vigilante groups. There's a list of 'em outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, carrying the GIRL, comes out of the police station a patrol car screeches to a halt in front of him.  Two co emerge, dragging a green alien with four arms.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN ALIEN
dialogues.text: I tell you I'm an American citizen. I just lost my papers.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (to himself) Goddamn illegal aliens. HARRY heads toward his cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here I was, stuck with this beautiful girl.  I knew she was gonna be nuthin' but trouble ... He looks around at the sleazy neighbourhood.  Every doorw and alley seems to have a rapist or thug lurking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but I didn't feel right just leaving her for the sickos.  I dunno, maybe I'm gettin' sentimental or something ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This futuristic bachelor pad is constructed entirely of b coloured molden plastic.  Bowling trophies sit on a shelf underneath a neon "Buweiser" clock.  The place is a mess. HARRY carries the GIRL in, pushes the light button to "On and lays her down on the sofa.  As he takes off his jacke he looks down at the unconscious figure - her clothes tor in all the right places.  She moans and starts to come to

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My place ... Walking over to a hi-tech plastic bar, HARRY pushes a but and a machine pours and mixes a drink.  He hands the GIRL glass.  She sits up and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (looking at Harry) They'd have killed me if it wasn't for you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What'd they want to snuff you for?
